column4: does anyone know how to setup up the permissions on an external hd so that i can read and write on it even if its on ntfs format

my friend is trying to install ubuntu to his machine, but his cd rom drive doesn't work so we copies the ubuntu image into my external hd. Then we try to boot of my external hd and we got a pxe-e61 error (media test failure)
so we copied the ubuntu image on the root directory of the hd to make it act like the cd
is there a way to trick the system to thinking that my external hd is a cdrom drive
What do you mean by that? What do you want to do specifically?
There's certainly a way to do it (most likely leaving the CD as an ISO)...
Do you have a floppy drive? :)
Are you in Windows, or in another Linux/UNIX distribution?
Do you have a USB key? :)
Okay... and the CD drive doesn't work *at all*? Or it's just not booting?
Anyway, there's some sort of advice at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SmartBootManagerHowto for booting without the CD (booting is the hardest part, mounting is easy after you're booted)
